snippet: The trade deficit swelled 15.6 percent, to $48.3 billion, in August, according to data that is adjusted for seasonal factors.
abstract: Commerce Dept reports American exports suffered in August due to global economic problems and imports from China increased, resulting in 15.6 increase in United States trade deficit, to $48.3 billion, largest expansion in five months.
lead_paragraph: The trade deficit swelled 15.6 percent, to $48.3 billion, in August, according to data that is adjusted for seasonal factors.

headline.main: U.S. Trade Deficit Surges as Exports Fall
headline.print_headline: Stumbles in Global Economy Widen the U.S. Trade Deficit
